key_mistakes.reason: Allowed significant material loss and worsened the position.
Did not address the threat and worsened the position.
Missed an opportunity to maintain pressure on the opponent.
Failed to improve the position and lost tempo.
Allowed the opponent to consolidate and gain a material advantage.
Blundered a piece, leading to a significant material disadvantage.
Traded into a losing position rather than seeking counterplay.
Failed to secure the king, leading to further exposure.
Exposed the king further, allowing for decisive tactics by the opponent.
Continued to expose the king, leading to eventual checkmate.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center early in the game.
Ensure king safety by castling promptly.
Avoid unnecessary piece exchanges that result in material loss.
Develop pieces to active squares to increase their effectiveness.
